item.title: AppBinding Overview
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. AppBinding What is AppBinding An AppBinding is a Kubernetes CustomResourceDefinition(CRD) which points to an application using either its URL (usually for a non-Kubernetes resident service instance) or a Kubernetes service object (if self-hosted in a Kubernetes cluster), some optional parameters and a credential secret. To learn more about AppBinding and the problems it solves, please read this blog post: The case for AppBinding.

item.title: Concepts | KubeDB
item.description: Concepts Concepts help you learn about the different parts of the KubeDB and the abstractions it uses. What is KubeDB Overview. Provides a conceptual introduction to KubeDB, including the problems it solves and its high-level architecture. Databases Elasticsearch. Introduces the concept of Elasticsearch to manage Elasticsearch using KubeDB. Memcached. Introduces the concept of Memcached to manage Memcached using KubeDB. MongoDB. Introduces the concept of MongoDB to manage MongoDB using KubeDB.

item.title: Snapshot
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This doc has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. We recommend using Stash to backup & restore Elasticsearch database. Snapshot What is Snapshot A Snapshot is a Kubernetes Custom Resource Definitions (CRD). It provides declarative configuration for database snapshots in a Kubernetes native way. You only need to describe the desired backup behavior in a Snapshot object.
